docs.snippet: Uber's decision to exit Southeast Asia, where it was bleeding money, should give the global ride-hailing giant more firepower to focus on India, where it's locked in a fierce battle with local rival, Ola, industry analysts say.

headline.print_headline: Uber Seen Girding for Battle With Ola in India Ahead of IPO
headline.main: Uber Seen Girding for Battle With Ola in India Ahead of IPO

docs.snippet: India on Wednesday allowed the import of used goods for repair and refurbishing on condition that the imported items are  exported - a move that could entice companies like smartphone maker Apple further into the Indian market.

headline.print_headline: India Beckons Big Tech Firms, Allows Imports of Used Goods for Repair
headline.main: India Beckons Big Tech Firms, Allows Imports of Used Goods for Repair

docs.snippet: The lengthy bans meted out to Australia's Steve Smith, David Warner and Cameron Bancroft on Wednesday rule them out of an end-of-year series against top-ranked India that could rival the intensity of their scandal-ridden tour to South Africa.

headline.print_headline: Ban on Trio Means They Miss Mouth-Watering Series v India
headline.main: Ban on Trio Means They Miss Mouth-Watering Series v India

docs.snippet: Vedanta Resources Plc said on Tuesday its India unit Vedanta Ltd's copper smelting operations at Thootukudi, in the southern state of Tamil Nadu, will be closed for about 15 days as part of a maintenance shutdown.

headline.print_headline: Vedanta to Shut Copper Smelter in India for About 15 Days
headline.main: Vedanta to Shut Copper Smelter in India for About 15 Days

docs.snippet: India's government has sent a notice to Facebook asking whether the personal data of Indian voters and users has been compromised by U.K.-based Cambridge Analytica or any other downstream entity.

headline.print_headline: India Sends Notice to Facebook Over Alleged Data Breach
headline.main: India Sends Notice to Facebook Over Alleged Data Breach

docs.snippet: India's Income Tax department has frozen Cognizant Technology Solutions Corp's bank accounts and deposits in Chennai and Mumbai for allegedly evading a dividend distribution tax (DDT), according to a report on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: India Tax Department Freezes Certain Cognizant Bank Accounts: Report
headline.main: India Tax Department Freezes Certain Cognizant Bank Accounts: Report

docs.snippet: Clashes in India between supporters of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's party and those of an opposition party snowballed into Hindu-Muslim rioting, with three people killed and dozens injured over two days of violence, police said on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Trouble at Hindu Festival in India Triggers Clashes With Muslims; Three Dead
headline.main: Trouble at Hindu Festival in India Triggers Clashes With Muslims; Three Dead

docs.snippet: India has set a March 31 deadline for London-based political consultancy Cambridge Analytica to respond to a query on whether it was engaged to improperly harvest Facebook data on Indian citizens, the information technology ministry said.

headline.print_headline: India Queries Cambridge Analytica Over Alleged Facebook Data Breach
headline.main: India Queries Cambridge Analytica Over Alleged Facebook Data Breach

docs.snippet: A massive $32 billion bailout package for India's dominant state-run banks will not happen again and lenders will have to find their own funding by selling non-core assets and merging with each other, a senior government official said on Monday....

headline.print_headline: India Pushes State Banks to Find Own Funding Sources After $32 Billion Bailout
headline.main: India Pushes State Banks to Find Own Funding Sources After $32 Billion Bailout

docs.snippet: Balkrishna Doshi, who won this year's Pritzker Prize, asks: “What is the role of an architect today, or are we going to be useful to the society at large?”

headline.main: Top Architecture Prize Goes to Low-Cost Housing Pioneer From India
